entry.title: Re: sapcs?serverInfo
entry.content:
I eventually got this figured out after trying multiple approaches.

C:\usr\sap\KP9\SYS\profile\cs.conf       is the correct location for my Content Server 7.54 configuration file

The Software Provisioning Tool created the entire path, but they did not create the cs.conf file.  It would have been nice if they had also created an empty cs.conf file with a comment in the file telling me to use appropriate SAP Notes to manually convert my old ContentServer.ini configuration settings to the appropriate syntax for the new Content Server 7.54.

The problem with the http://<my_server_name>:1090/sapcs?serverInfo not working was due to a non-existent cs.conf file.  Additionally, I learned later, that the http://<my_server_name>:1090/sapcs?serverInfo test will not work if cs.conf has "Security=1" set

entry.title: Request for Method to Delete or Adjust Transactions in In-House Bank Account Balances
entry.content:
We would like to confirm if there is a way to delete or adjust transactions registered in the in-house bank account balances.

When importing MT940 statements, we update the virtual account balances based on the information provided in the memo line.
However, in this case, incorrect information was included in the memo line, which resulted in an unintended transaction being created in the in-house bank account.

We would like to know if there is a way to correct this transaction.
For example, is it possible to create a reversal transaction for the same amount with the opposite sign, or to invalidate the transaction in some way?

Thank you for your support.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Request for Method to Delete or Adjust Transactions i...
entry.content: You can reverse the wrongly posted bank statement items in the Reprocess Bank Statement Items and Reprocess Lockbox Items app. Kindly refer to the SAP Help Portal How to Reverse Postings

entry.title: Re: sapcs?serverInfo
entry.content:
The original command, http://<my_server_name>:1090/ContentServer/ContentServer.dll?serverInfo, was still working because it was connecting to the old Content Server 6.5 which I had not stopped yet.

To get the new command, http://<my_server_name>:1090/sapcs?serverInfo to work, I had to correctly configure the new cs.conf file, stop the old Content Server 6.5 and start the new Content Server 7.54.

In addition, I had to have Security=0 to get the http:// commands to work.

entry.title: Onboarding Documents Restrict Access
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

In Onboarding 2.0 within the Onboarding Dashboard under an onboardee there is an 'Actions' option from where we can access 'Onboarding Documents'.

 

Is it possible to restrict certain types of documents from appearing on that list?

For example, I would like one HR Manager to be able to see all the generated and signed documents, but for a different HR Officer to be able to see only certain documents (e.g. signed Policy Docs, but not be able to see Signed Contracts).

Is there a way to achieve this?

 

I have tried RBP, disabling the 'View Documents Permission' will completely remove the option of 'Onboarding Documents' which is not ideal in this case.

Also I have tried 'Document Category Access' and selected specific category of document but it also does not seem to be working.  The HR officer could see documents that were not listed on the permission.

Can anyone share some knowledge if this is achievable or if there is a workaround?

 

Thanks!

entry.title: Display String function not working in CR 2025
entry.content:
Long time user of CR 2013, currently testing CR 2025.

Placed a Formula Field ({Command.STATUS}, it's a single-character text string)  within a report header section.

Right click on the field, select Format Field, then select the X2 formula button next to Display String: on the Common tab.

Enter formula:

  'Part Status: ' + {Command.STATUS}

Click Save.  The X2 formula button is now red indicating the presence of a formatting formula.  If I click the X2 button, I can see that my formula is still there.

Click OK to close the Format Editor.  Report does not show the new display string.  Re-open Format Editor; the X2 button is no longer red and if I click it, my format formula is gone.

This is a simple task that I have repeated probably thousands of times.  Why is it not working?

entry.title: Re: SAP TM Transportation Proposal
entry.content:
Hi @Marco89 

Thank you for your question.

Based on your explanations, you seem to be on the right track with your SAP TM configuration, especially recognizing the value of multi-stage routing.

Yes, it is possible to generate transportation proposals in SAP TM without using the VSR Optimizer but there are some limitations in achieving that. While basic proposals can be handled manually, multi-stage or alternative routing options like A-->C-->D-->B and A-->C-->E-->B typically require the Optimizer to evaluate and propose the most efficient combinations dynamically.

Without the optimizer, SAP TM wonâ€™t be able to automatically generate all possible route combinations unless theyâ€™re explicitly predefined in your master data.

I suggest you do the following:

  • Define all relevant locations and transshipment points.
  • Set up trade lanes and transportation lanes for each segment (A-->C, C-->D, D-->B, etc.).
  • Assign valid carriers and schedules.
  • Configure the transportation proposal settings correctly in SPRO.

Youâ€™ll find transportation proposals limited to these manually defined paths and wonâ€™t get optimization-based proposals such as cost/time comparison without the VSR engine.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Flexible workflow approver of Lean service sheet base...
entry.content:
Hi @GKestowicz 

Thank you for your question. I will walk you through possible solution.

In standard SAP S/4HANA on-premise 2023 edition, the Flexible Workflow currently provides condition-based routing primarily for Account Assignment Category = P. This uses standard fields like Project Definition or Responsible Person.

Unfortunately, approver determination based on the Network (category = N) is not directly supported through standard configuration.

However, there is a feasible solution and below is my recommendation:

You can implement a custom BADI, such as:

  • Use the â€œSWF_WORKFLOW_CONDITION_EVALâ€ to define a custom workflow condition.
  • Then use â€œWSBFI_FLEX_WF_AGENTSâ€ to determine the approver dynamically based on the network responsible or the related attributes.

Please note that this approach will allow you to do the following:

  • Extract the network number from the entry sheet.
  • Map it to the appropriate responsible person or org unit.
  • Route the workflow accordingly.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: 2 Outbound Delivery getting Created for 2 Line item o...
entry.content:
Hi @SAI098 

Thank you for your message. Though the questions is not very clear, I believe I understand what your issue is.

Your observation is clear. In SAP standard behaviour, the system creates separate deliveries when requirement dates differ across components in the Purchase Order. This is controlled by delivery split criteria in the delivery creation logic.

Suggestion on how to solve it:

Ensure that all components within the PO line items have the same requirement date maintained under the Material tab in item details.
This ensures the system recognizes the items as deliverable together, allowing them to be grouped into a single delivery.

These actions can be carried out by:

  • Transaction: ME22N (Change Purchase Order)
  • Select line item Ã  Go to Item Details Ã  Material Data tab
  • Align the requirement dates across all components

Once aligned, the system should generate a single delivery without a split. This will happen only if no other split criteria for example â€œship-to party, plant, storage locationâ€ are triggered.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Wrong Diff Quantity shown in EWM Monitor for Physical...
entry.content:
Hi @RajathRM 

Thank you for reaching out. I will walk you through.

You seem to be observing for Batch 01092026, the Book Quantity = 70, but the Counted Quantity = 72, yet the Diff. Qty = 70, which is clearly incorrect. Similarly, for other entries, differences don't reconcile logically.

Based on your screenshot and description, the difference quantity is likely caused by either batch-related split records, recounts not yet posted, or inconsistencies between counted and book quantities not reflected due to buffering. It is not a bug, but rather a data state issue.

I recommend you carry out the following steps:

  1. Run Report RM07I001 to check inconsistencies in inventory documents.
  2. Execute transaction MI24 to see the correct difference report.
  3. Review movement history in MB51 for the material and batches involved.
  4. Check for open recounts in MI22 and make sure they are posted correctly.
  5. Ensure no pending WM activities for example â€œpending TOs in LT24â€ if you are using WM.

If after you have carried out all checks the values still appear incorrect in LX17 or MI20, you can use report RIMODGEN to regenerate the physical inventory data.

 

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Can ex-post forecast values for each historical perio...
entry.content:
Hi @Brandon_Jones 

Thank you for your question.

Yes, it is possible to store ex-post forecast values for each historical period in a dedicated key figure during the Test Phase in SAP IBP. This can be very helpful for evaluating model performance and refining forecasting strategies.

I suggest you take this approach:

  1. Define your required custom key figure for example â€œKF_EX_POST_FORECASTâ€, with the appropriate planning levels and time granularity.
  2. Then, configure the forecast model in the Forecasting application to store the ex-post forecast results. Make sure to use the following:
    • Forecast Output Key Figure Mapping in the model configuration.
    • Assign the ex-post values to the custom key figure.
  3. Afterwards, ensure that your error calculation horizon aligns with the test horizon to enable a defined period-by-period comparisons.
  4. You also have the option to configure an analytics chart or use Excel UI to display the actual vs. ex-post forecast for each historical period.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Best Custom Packaging Company in USA in 2025?
entry.content:
Hi @jenniferjames 

Thanks for sharing your experience

This is indeed becoming a hot topic with the rise of personalized and sustainable packaging in eCommerce and omni-channel fulfillment.

Here are my answers to your questions:

  1. Integration with External Packaging Vendors

Yes, it is possible to integrate external packaging providers like Packaging Unit with SAP EWM. Please note that it often requires a mix of custom APIs and master data synchronization:

  • Packaging Material Master Data. You can create packaging materials in SAP ERP/EWM and sync them with the vendorâ€™s system via iDocs or REST APIs.
  • Regarding automatic Packing, EWM can propose packing instructions via Packing specifications which can then be extended to include vendor packaging options.
  1. Auto-Creation of Packaging in Outbound Deliveries
  • Using Packing Specifications and Condition Technique, EWM is able to automatically determine the correct packaging material based on product dimensions, weight, and order volume.
  • Some companies connect external packaging tools (like Cape Pack, or custom vendor APIs) to feed optimal cartonization data directly into their EWM during wave planning.
  1. Tools & Tips
  • SAP CPI is a good middleware for integrating vendors like Packaging Unit.
  • Handling Unit Templates in EWM can store vendor-specific packaging logic, for example branded boxes.
  • I suggest you consider leveraging BRF+ in EWM to dynamically select packaging types based on customer or sales channel. This is very useful for branded or eco-friendly packaging.

I hope this gives you clarity. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: How to Cascade Production Cuts from a Semi-Finished P...
entry.content:
Hi @SAPEY_AO 

Thanks for your question. Let me walk you through it.

Please note, within SAP IBP S&OP (without activating Supply & Response), manual adjustments to the production plan for a semi-finished product do not automatically cascade to finished products.

To answer your question: Can Production Cut at Semi-Finished Level Cascade to Finished Goods?

This doe does not happen automatically and here is why:

  • In an IBP S&OP setup without Supply & Response, adjusting your semi-finished product plan does not automatically reduce the dependent demand or production plan for finished goods even if there's a BOM relationship.
  • This behaviour is confirmed in SAP Community Q&A where planners note that manual changes to semi-finished items are not reflected downstream unless Supply & Response or Supply Planning is also activated.

The heuristic treats changes at each level independently. That means without Supply Planning logic, the finished goods plan remains unchanged.

Here are the reasons:

  • The S&OP heuristic propagates demand and supply based on sourcing rules, but it does not re-calculate dependent demand when there are manual cuts at higher levels.
  • No visibility or enforcement of capacity constraints at component levels since supply planning features are disabled.

Here is my suggestion (workaround) on how to align them, consider:

  • Manually reducing demand or production for impacted finished products.
  • Using adjustment key figures to simulate the impact downstream.
  • Applying BOM logic via custom formulas or Excel operators.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Lag Based Snapshot Operator - Batch Size is 0 | Snaps...
entry.content:
Hi @MallikarjunB 

Thanks for the detailed breakdown.

The â€œBatch size is 0â€ error in the Lag-Based Snapshot operator typically means thereâ€™s no valid data matching the operator settings. This often due to:

  • The target key figure doesnâ€™t have Lag as a root attribute in its base planning level.
  • The planning level itself doesnâ€™t include Lag.
  • The defined lags may not align with your data or master data setup.

Here is what I suggest:

  1. Open Manage Planning Area â€“> ensure your planning level contains Lag.
  2. Confirm your target key figure uses that same planning level.
  3. Use the Manage Lag-Based Snapshot Profiles app to verify your snapshot profile setup (source, target, defined lags).

Once you have properly configured Lag and aligned across planning level, KF, and operator profile, the snapshot will execute with valid batch size and appear in Excel.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Unable to Clear Special G/L Transactions with CME Ind...
entry.content:
Hello @Blas4 @

Good question! Special G/L indicator S is typically used for down payment requests, while A is used for actual down payments.

Please check the configuration in SSCUI 101044 â€“ Configure Payment Methods for Country/Company Code, and make sure:

  • The payment method allows Special G/L transactions.
  • The indicator S is supported for your posting scenario.

In SAP S/4HANA Public cloud, the use of special G/L indicators is predefined, so if you're posting an actual down payment, you should use A instead of S.

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Price change of Material by Fiori app Manage Material...
entry.content:
Hello @ai_takahashi 

Since release 2105, the price change carried over to current period behaviour is standard and non-configurable in SAP S4 Public cloud. This means that any price change posted in a closed period is automatically applied in the current period and cannot be reversed, including via FB08.

This behaviour supports period consistency and aligns with the cloud fit-to-standard approach.

For IFRS compliance where reversals may be required youâ€™ll need to handle such adjustments via parallel ledgers (e.g., 0L for IFRS) or manual postings, rather than reversing the material valuation itself.

Manage Material Valuations-App ID: F2680

Best regards,

Chuma

entry.title: Unlocking Multilingual Document Translation with SAP Build Apps + SAP BTP Translation Hub
entry.content:
In our previous blog post, we explored how to enable text translation within SAP Build Apps using SAP Translation Hub, making apps more inclusive and globally accessible.

Now, letâ€™s take this a step further. What if you need to translate entire documentsâ€”like Word files, PDFs, or HTML content? In this post, weâ€™ll demonstrate how to integrate SAP Build Apps with SAP Translation Hub to create a document translation flowâ€”quickly, efficiently, and without writing extensive code.

ğŸ“–Story: One Quote, Two Languages â€” One Lost Deal?

Meet Alex, a sales manager at a global electronics company based in Germany. Heâ€™s chasing a big opportunity with a Japanese client. The quote is ready, the price is right â€” but itâ€™s in English. The client requests it in Japanese.

Alex scrambles. He asks a colleague for help. He copy-pastes parts of the quote into a translation tool. He worries about accuracy, especially with technical terms. Meanwhile, the competitor â€” who sent a native-language quote â€” wins the deal

Could this have been avoided? Absolutely.

Enter SAP Build Apps + SAP Translation Hub â€” a powerful no-code solution to translate sales quotes and documents instantly, either as a standalone tool or tightly integrated with SAP CX Sales Cloud.

ğŸ§° Prerequisites

To implement this solution, youâ€™ll need:

  • âœ…SAP BTP subaccount with access to:
    • SAP Build Apps
    • SAP Translation Hub (entitlement required)
  • âœ…SAP CX Sales Cloud (optional, for embedded use case)
  • âœ…Document format: PDF, DOCX, or HTML
  • âœ…BTP Destination or integration layer (CAP / SAP Integration Suite)

ğŸ¯Use Case: Quote Translation in SAP Sales Cloud

Sales teams often generate quotes in their default language. However, sending proposals in a customerâ€™s native language improves clarity, trust, and conversion rates.

Example:
A salesperson in Spain generates a quote in English and wants to send it to a client in Brazil. Using this solution, the salesperson uploads the quote, selects â€œPortuguese (Brazil)â€ as the target language, and receives a translated document â€” within seconds.

The translated document is then sent directly to the customer or attached to the Sales Cloud opportunity.

ğŸ› ï¸ How It Works

  1. Generate Quote (SAP CX Sales Cloud): Standard PDF/Word output from a quote process.
  2. Upload to SAP Build Apps: User uploads the file and selects target language.
  3. Translation via SAP Translation Hub: The file is translated via secure API calls.
  4. Return Translated File: File is returned as downloadable content or pushed back to SAP Sales Cloud in attachment Tab.

ğŸ”„ Deployment Options: Standalone or Integrated

Option 1: Standalone App (No SAP CX Required)

  • A universal tool for business users across sales, legal, procurement, etc.
  • Upload any business document and get instant translations.
  • Deploy via SAP Build Apps and BTP â€” no coding needed.
  • Useful even for companies not yet using SAP Sales Cloud.

Option 2: Embedded in SAP CX Sales Cloud

  • Add translation buttons directly in the Quote Object Page.
  • Automatically trigger translation after quote generation.
  • Store translated versions in the same quote  record.

ğŸ“ˆ Business Benefits

Benefit Standalone App SAP Sales Cloud Integration

BenefitStandalone AppSAP Sales Cloud Integration
ğŸŒGlobal content readinessâœ…Translate any documentâœ…Translate sales-specific content
ğŸ•’Fast time-to-quoteâœ…Instant translationâœ…Automated translation post-quote
ğŸ› ï¸ Low-code implementationâœ…Fully no-code UIâœ…Extendable via BTP/Events
ğŸ”Secure enterprise workflowâœ…Controlled via BTP authâœ…Audit-ready and version controlled
ğŸ“¦Reusable across teamsâœ…Any department can useâœ…Tight sales workflow integration

SAP Translation Hub - Document Translation - Overview

 

 

 

Benefit Standalone App SAP Sales Cloud Integration

Step By Step

Please create the destination with the necessary values.

Drag and drop the required components onto the user interface.

Fetch and bind available languages directly from the Translation Hub API

Upload the PDF file in English format from the local file system

After selecting the target language, click the "Translate" button to proceed.

Video

Until now, we explored the process as a standalone document. Now, letâ€™s look at how this can be embedded within the CX Sales Cloud V2 Quote :

  • ğŸ’¼Seamless Integration with CX Sales Cloud V2 Quote
    Embed the translation workflow directly into the quoting process.
  • ğŸ“„Sales Representative Uploads the Quote PDF
    The sales rep can upload a quote document in their native language.
  • ğŸŒAutomatic Translation to Desired Language
    The uploaded PDF is translated into the target language using SAP Translation Hub.
  • ğŸ“Translated Document Attached Automatically
    The translated PDF is added to the Attachments tab of the quote.
  • âœ‰ï¸Send via DocuSign for Digital Signature
    The finalized, translated quote is sent to the customer through DocuSign for e-signature.

Embed the above standardized document into the Sales Cloud V2 Quote document.

The document was originally shared via a standard email. This same method can also be utilized to initiate a DocuSign signature request

Architecture

SAP Sales Cloud 
                     â†“
SAP Build Apps UI (File Upload + Language )
                     â†“
BTP Integration (Destination)
                    â†“
SAP Translation Hub API (Document Translation)
                    â†“
Translated Quote Returned to Build App â†’ Uploaded back to Sales Cloud or emailed

ğŸ“Conclusion

Translating sales quotes and documents no longer needs to be a manual, error-prone, or time-consuming task. With the powerful combination of SAP Build Apps and SAP Translation Hub, businesses can easily deliver personalized, localized contentâ€”whether in a standalone translation portal or as an embedded feature within SAP Sales Cloud.

This solution empowers sales teams to communicate more effectively, close deals faster, and build stronger relationships with global customersâ€”all without writing a single line of code on the frontend.

As businesses continue to expand across borders, language accessibility becomes a strategic advantage. By embracing low-code translation automation, you're not just simplifying operations â€” you're enhancing the customer experience where it counts the most.

entry.title: Overview of a Reference ESG IT Architecture using SAP Sustainability Control Tower as central app
entry.content:
Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) is a framework for assessing an organizationâ€™s practices and performance on sustainability and ethical issues. An effective ESG IT architecture supports rapid growth, adapts to evolving requirements, enables flexible reporting, ensures robust data security, and fosters stakeholder trust through transparent and accountable practices.

 

"You can have data without information, but you cannot have information without data," by Daniel Keys Moran, is highly relevant to ESG data management.
 
Good decisions are the foundation for embracing ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) changes. These decisions rely on data, which is why there's a growing demand for ESG-related information. A company's IT system supports smart and fast decisions by providing clear insights on emissions, natural resources, and employees across the entire business. This leads to better investments, lower risks, an improved supply chain, stronger resilience, and attracts new customers, lenders, and investors.
 
A solid IT strategy is super important for hitting ESG targets. Many companies have some idea of their ESG impact, but a focused ESG IT setup can make it easier to measure, track, and improve their impact. This can uncover ways to cut waste, reduce carbon emissions, protect nature, and boost social good. Itâ€™s critical for reaching bigger ESG goals.
 
A well-designed and properly implemented IT system or IT architecture is essential for successfully guiding an organizationâ€™s ESG strategy and integrating it into business processes. The IT architecture Iâ€™m referring to is a comprehensive, organization-wide system that spans all business areas and is guided by the organizationâ€™s ESG strategy or we can call it as a ESG IT Architecture. 

The ESG IT architecture is divided into four vertical layers, each representing a distinct function in the data lifecycle: Data Generation & Collection, Data Harmonization, Contextualization, and Staging, Data Analysis, and Steering and Reporting. These layers are supported by Data Governance, such as Master Data Management, Data Security and Privacy which ensure consistency, security, and governance across the ESG data lifecycle.

 
1. Data Generation and Collection
The Data Generation & Collection layer serves as the foundational step in the ESG data pipeline, where raw data related to environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors is generated or sourced from diverse internal and external systems. This layer encompasses several key components: ESG-specific systems that capture data on emissions, environmental, health, and safety (EHS) metrics, sustainability indicators, and external ESG ratings; business transaction systems such as ERP, SCM, and HRMS, which provide critical business context like travel, procurement, and logistics data relevant to ESG impact; and other sources, including utility consumption records, IoT devices, facility management systems, and satellite or geospatial data. This layer feeds raw, often unstructured or semi-structured data into the Data Integration layer, where it must be normalized across various formats and systems to enable effective analysis.
 
2. Data Integration
The Data Integration layer transforms diverse raw data into a harmonized, contextualized, and structured format suitable for analysis. Its key components include an Enterprise Data Hub, which serves as a central platform for collecting data from all sources, and a Central ESG Data Hub, a specialized repository designed for ESG analytics and reporting. Processes such as data harmonization (standardizing formats), contextualization (adding meaning or context), and staging (temporary storage before use) are critical. This layer acts as a bridge, receiving data from the Data Generation & Collection layer and sending clean, consistent data to the Data Analysis layer for further processing.
 
3. Dat Analysis
This layer leverages cleaned and structured data to generate actionable ESG insights, perform calculations, and support sustainability goal-setting. Key components include the SAP Sustainability Control Tower, a central analytics platform, alongside ESG dimensions (e.g., emissions, diversity, safety), KPI calculations to track performance, and ESG metrics derived from integrated data. It also facilitates short- and long-term ESG goal planning. The layer ingests harmonized data from the Integration layer, provides analytical outputs to the Steering & Reporting layer, and may feed data back into operational systems to enhance processes.
 
4. Steering & Reporting
The final layer facilitates decision-making, internal governance, and external ESG disclosures by leveraging insights from the Data Analysis layer. Its key components include ESG reporting for regulatory (mandatory), voluntary, and internal purposes; management of ESG programs like decarbonization or circular economy initiatives; and advanced analytics, such as predictive modeling, real-time dashboards, and visual storytelling. This layer relies on accurate and timely insights from the Data Analysis layer to enable business units and executives to steer ESG strategy. Reporting outputs may also create a feedback loop, influencing data generation practices to refine the overall process.
 
The ESG IT architecture transforms raw data into actionable insights through a cohesive, interconnected framework. It collects and normalizes diverse data, integrates and harmonizes it for analysis, and generates ESG metrics to support goal-setting. The steering and reporting layer drives decision-making and compliance, enhancing organizational ESG performance.
 
Thank you for taking the time to read my blog. I truly appreciate your interest with this critical topic. If you have any thoughts, questions, or ideas to share, please feel free to leave a comment.
 
Sreekanth

entry.title: Excel Upload/Download for Custom Tables â€“ With Check Table Validation
entry.content:
Hi Community,
In this blog, weâ€™ll explore how to build a custom ABAP utility that enables Excel-based upload and download functionality for Z-tables, with real-time validation against check table entries. This solution allows users to generate Excel templates, validate input data during upload, and update custom tables dynamically all from a single report.

Introduction

In many SAP projects, business users request Excel-based upload and download features for ease of data entry and mass maintenance. However, ensuring data integrity during uploadsâ€”especially for custom tables with check table dependenciesâ€”is crucial.
This blog showcases a utility report in ABAP that enables:

  • Downloading a Z-table structure into Excel from Se16N

  • Uploading Excel data back into SAP

  • Validating data against defined check tables

  • Updating the custom table only if validation passes

Letâ€™s walk through the solution with modular includes, class-based design, and user-friendly error handling via SALV.

Solution Overview

The solution is built using:

  • Modular Includes: Top declarations, selection screens, class definitions, and implementations are separated for clarity.

  • Dynamic Programming: Internal tables and field symbols are generated at runtime based on the table name.

  • SOI Interface: SAP Office Integration is used to parse Excel.

  • Check Table Validation: All dependent fields are validated using metadata (from DDIF_FIELDINFO_GET).

  • Error Handling: Errors are displayed using SALV with row indicators.

Selection Screen Design

Two main modes:

  • Export: Generates an Excel template based on a selected custom table and navigates to SE16N.

  • Import: Reads and uploads validated Excel content into the corresponding Z-table.

 

Below is the Report Program zcustom_excel

REPORT zcustom_excel.
INCLUDE zcust_excel_top.
INCLUDE zcust_excel_sel.
INCLUDE zcust_excel_cls_dfn.
INCLUDE zcust_excel_cls_dec.
INITIALIZATION.
  CLEAR: go_ref.
  go_ref = NEW lcl_header_values( ).
  go_ref->initialize( ).
AT SELECTION-SCREEN OUTPUT.
  LOOP AT SCREEN INTO DATA(ls_screen).
    IF ls_screen-name CS 'PATH'.
      ls_screen-active = COND #( WHEN rb_exp = abap_true THEN 0 ELSE 1 ).
      MODIFY SCREEN FROM ls_screen.
    ENDIF.
  ENDLOOP.
AT SELECTION-SCREEN.
  go_ref->file_import( ).
AT SELECTION-SCREEN ON VALUE-REQUEST FOR p_path.
  go_ref->pop_up_dialogue( ).
START-OF-SELECTION.
  go_ref->operation( ).
â€‹

Top Declaration is done in INCLUDE zcust_excel_top. 

TYPES:BEGIN OF gty_msg, 
         lights(4) TYPE c, 
         row       TYPE i, 
         message   TYPE tdline, 
       END OF gty_msg. 
 DATA:gs_msg          TYPE gty_msg, 
      gt_msg          TYPE TABLE OF gty_msg, 
      gv_wtitle       TYPE string , 
      gv_format       TYPE string, 
      gt_dyn_tab      TYPE REF TO data, 
      gt_dyn_tab1     TYPE REF TO data, 
      go_salv         TYPE REF TO cl_salv_table, 
 ##NEEDED      gv_msg          TYPE REF TO cx_salv_msg,

 CLASS lcl_header_values IMPLEMENTATION.
 
"File_import method is used to do the validation based on Input table name in "selection screen.  
METHOD file_import.
 
    SELECT low FROM tvarvc WHERE name = 'ZCUST_TAB_TVARVC' AND low = @p_tab INTO TABLE (lt_tvarvc).
 
    CASE sy-ucomm.
 
      WHEN  'ONLI'.

        IF p_path IS INITIAL AND rb_imp EQ abap_true.

    ENDCASE.
 

  ENDMETHOD.
 
  METHOD operation.
 
    DATA:lt_excel    TYPE TABLE OF alsmex_tabline,
 
         lv_col      TYPE i,

TYPES: BEGIN OF hex_record,
 
                 myhex TYPE x LENGTH 1024,
 
               END OF hex_record.

"Based on custom table name it will navigate to se16n screen

      SET PARAMETER ID 'DTB' FIELD p_tab.
"Providing Authorization

               ID 'TCD' FIELD 'SE16N'.
 
      IF sy-subrc EQ 0.
 
        CALL TRANSACTION  lv_transaction.

        MESSAGE 'User dont have authorization for SE16N T-Code' TYPE 'E'.
 
      ENDIF.
 
    ELSEIF rb_imp EQ abap_true.
 "Here we are mainataining some custom table that supposed to insert the data 
      SELECT low FROM tvarvc WHERE name = 'ZCUST_TAB_TVARVC' AND low = @p_tab INTO TABLE (lt_tvarvc).
 
      IF lt_tvarvc IS NOT INITIAL.
 
"Here we are Creating the dynamic internal table based on the table we have "provided in the selection screen
        CREATE DATA gt_dyn_tab TYPE  TABLE OF (p_tab).
 
        CREATE DATA gs_dyn_tab TYPE (p_tab).
 
        CREATE DATA gt_dyn_tab1 TYPE  TABLE OF (p_tab).
 
        ASSIGN gt_dyn_tab->* TO <fs_dyn>.
 
        ASSIGN gt_dyn_tab1->* TO <fs_dyn1>.
 
        ASSIGN gs_dyn_tab->* TO <fs_dyns>.
 
        
 
        gv_filename = p_path.
 


        cl_sovy_container_control=>get_container_control(
 
          EXPORTING

                                     IMPORTING document_proxy = DATA(document_proxy) ).

           EXPORTING
             filename   = gv_filename

             data_tab   = lt_upload.
 

        document_proxy->open_document_from_table( document_size  = lv_filelength
 
                                                 document_table = lt_upload ).
 
        document_proxy->get_spreadsheet_interface( IMPORTING sheet_interface = DATA(sheet) ).
 
        DATA sheetname TYPE soi_field_name.
 
        sheetname = 'Sheet1'.
 
        sheet->get_active_sheet( IMPORTING sheetname = sheetname ).

               ls_data  TYPE soi_generic_item.
 
        sheet->get_ranges_data( EXPORTING rangesdef = rangesdef
 
                                IMPORTING contents  = contents
 
                                CHANGING  ranges    = ranges ).
 
        IF sy-subrc EQ 0.
 
*** --- Sort
 
          SORT lt_excel BY row.
 

*          LOOP AT lt_excel INTO DATA(ls_excel).
 
          LOOP AT contents INTO ls_data.
 
*** --- Adding count to skip the mapping for MANDT field
 
*            lv_col = ls_excel-col + 1.
 
            lv_col = ls_data-column + 1.
 

            ASSIGN COMPONENT lv_col OF STRUCTURE <fs_dyns> TO <fs_dyn_field>.
 
            IF sy-subrc = 0.
 
***-- Compare Excel sheet column data and Dynamic table fields
 
*              IF ls_excel-row = 1.
 
              IF ls_data-row = 1.
 
                CALL FUNCTION 'DDIF_FIELDINFO_GET'      "#EC CI_SUBRC
                   EXPORTING
                     tabname        = p_tab
                   TABLES
                     dfies_tab      = gt_table_filds
                   EXCEPTIONS ##FM_SUBRC_OK
                     not_found      = 1

                IF sy-subrc IS NOT INITIAL.

                ENDIF.
 
                READ TABLE gt_table_filds INTO DATA(ls_table_fields) INDEX lv_col.
 
                IF sy-subrc = 0.
 

                  IF ls_table_fields-scrtext_m EQ ls_data-value OR ls_table_fields-scrtext_l EQ ls_data-value  .
 
                  ELSE.
 
                    MESSAGE 'Provided table is not matching with the Excel data ' TYPE 'E'.

                  ENDIF.
 
                ENDIF.
 
              ELSE.
 
*                <fs_dyn_field> = ls_excel-value.
                 <fs_dyn_field> = ls_data-value.
 
              ENDIF.
 
            ENDIF.
 
*            IF ls_excel-row GT 1.
 
            DATA(lv_val) = ls_data-value.
 
            IF ls_data-row GT 1.
 
              AT NEW row.
 
                IF lv_val IS INITIAL .
 
                  EXIT.
 
                ENDIF.
 
              ENDAT .
 
              AT END OF row.
 
                IF <fs_dyns>  IS ASSIGNED AND  <fs_dyn> IS ASSIGNED.
 
                  APPEND <fs_dyns> TO <fs_dyn>.
 
                ENDIF.
 
                CLEAR <fs_dyns>.
 
              ENDAT.
 
            ENDIF.
 
*            NEW
 
*            ENDIF.
 
*            end
 
          ENDLOOP.
 
        ENDIF.
 


        "Excel data to validate
 
        LOOP AT <fs_dyn> ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<lfs_dn1>).
 
          lv_count =  lv_count + 1.
 
          CLEAR:lv_flag.
 
          "Checking for any custom table is linked with Check table
 
          LOOP AT gt_table_filds ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<lfs_tab>) WHERE checktable IS NOT INITIAL. "#EC CI_NESTED
 
            "To fetch the Check table information
 
            ASSIGN COMPONENT <lfs_tab>-fieldname OF STRUCTURE <lfs_dn1> TO  <fs_val>.
 
            IF <fs_val> IS ASSIGNED AND <fs_val> IS NOT INITIAL.
 
              IF <lfs_tab>-fieldname EQ 'MATNR'.
 
                CALL FUNCTION 'CONVERSION_EXIT_MATN1_INPUT'     "#EC CI_SUBRC
                   EXPORTING
                     input        = <fs_val>
                   IMPORTING
                     output       = <fs_val>
                   EXCEPTIONS
                     length_error = 1
                     OTHERS       = 2.
 
                IF sy-subrc <> 0.
 
                  MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno
 
                          WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4.
 
                ENDIF.
 
              ELSE.
                 <fs_val> = |{ <fs_val> ALPHA = IN }|.
 
              ENDIF.
 
              CALL FUNCTION 'DDIF_FIELDINFO_GET'  "#EC CI_SUBRC
                 EXPORTING
                   tabname        = <lfs_tab>-checktable
                 TABLES
                   dfies_tab      = gt_table_filds1
                 EXCEPTIONS
                   not_found      = 1
                   internal_error = 2
                   OTHERS         = 3.
 
              IF sy-subrc IS NOT INITIAL.
 
                MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno
 
                        WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4.
 
              ENDIF.
 
              READ TABLE gt_table_filds1  INTO DATA(ls_fields1) WITH KEY domname = <lfs_tab>-domname."Reading the Check table field
 
              IF sy-subrc EQ 0.
 
                lv_field = ls_fields1-fieldname.   "check table field
 
                lv_table = <lfs_tab>-checktable.  "check table name
 
                "Comparing each Excel data with the check table value if it is exist or not
 
                lv_clause = |{ lv_field }| && | = | && |'| && |{ <fs_val> }| && |'| .
 
                SELECT SINGLE (lv_field)  FROM (lv_table) INTO ls_tab WHERE (lv_clause). "#EC CI_SUBRC
 
                CLEAR :ls_tab.
 
                IF sy-subrc NE 0.
 
                  gs_msg-message = TEXT-010. "text-010(Data has not updated)
 
                  gs_msg-row = lv_count.
 
                  gs_msg-lights = 1.
 
                  APPEND gs_msg TO gt_msg.
 
                  CLEAR:gs_msg.
 
                  lv_flag = abap_true.
 
                ENDIF.
 
              ENDIF.
 
            ENDIF.
 
          ENDLOOP.
 
*        IF sy-subrc NE 0.
 
          IF lv_flag EQ abap_false.
 
            gs_msg-message = TEXT-011 .
 
            gs_msg-row = lv_count.
 
            gs_msg-lights = 3.
 
            APPEND gs_msg TO gt_msg.
 
            CLEAR:gs_msg.
 
            APPEND <lfs_dn1> TO <fs_dyn1>.
 
            CLEAR: <lfs_dn1>.
 
          ENDIF.
 
        ENDLOOP.
//Locking the table.
        IF <fs_dyn1> IS ASSIGNED AND <fs_dyn1> IS NOT INITIAL.
 
          CALL FUNCTION 'ENQUEUE_E_TABLE'
             EXPORTING
               mode_rstable   = 'E'
               tabname        = p_tab
             EXCEPTIONS
               foreign_lock   = 1
               system_failure = 2
               OTHERS         = 3.
 
          IF sy-subrc EQ 0.
 
            MODIFY (p_tab) FROM TABLE <fs_dyn1>.
 
            IF sy-subrc EQ 0.
 
              COMMIT WORK.
 
            ELSE.
 
              ROLLBACK WORK.
 
            ENDIF.
 
            CALL FUNCTION 'DEQUEUE_E_TABLE'
               EXPORTING
                 mode_rstable = 'E'
                 tabname      = p_tab.
 
          ENDIF.
 
                                                          "#EC CI_SUBRC
 
        ENDIF.
 
*Data is updated succussfully without any interruption then display's below message
 
        IF gt_msg IS INITIAL.
 
          MESSAGE TEXT-008 TYPE 'S'.  "text-008(Data is Updated succussfully)
 
        ENDIF.
 
        IF gt_msg IS NOT INITIAL.
 
          TRY.
 
              cl_salv_table=>factory(
 
                IMPORTING
 
                  r_salv_table = go_salv                       " Basis Class Simple ALV Tables
 
                CHANGING
 
                  t_table      = gt_msg
 
              ).
 
            ##NO_HANDLER            CATCH cx_salv_msg INTO gv_msg.
 
          ENDTRY.
 
          TRY.
 
              lo_cols = go_salv->get_columns( ).
 
              lo_cols->set_exception_column(
 
                value = 'LIGHTS' ).
 
            ##NO_HANDLER  CATCH cx_salv_data_error.
 
          ENDTRY.
 
          TRY.
 
              lo_column = lo_cols->get_column( columnname = 'ROW' ).
 
              lo_column->set_long_text( â€˜Row' ).
 
              lo_column->set_medium_text( 'Rowâ€™ ).
 
              lo_column->set_short_text( â€˜Rowâ€™ ).
 
              lo_column->set_output_length( 6 ).
 

              lo_column = lo_cols->get_column( columnname = 'MESSAGE' ).
 
              lo_column->set_long_text( â€˜Messageâ€™ ).
 
              lo_column->set_medium_text( â€˜Messageâ€™ ).
 
              lo_column->set_short_text( â€˜Message' ).
 
              lo_column->set_output_length( 15 ).
 
            ##NO_HANDLER           CATCH cx_salv_not_found.
 
          ENDTRY.
 

**Displaying the Error mesage in ouput
 
          go_salv->display( ).
 
          CLEAR:gt_msg.
 
        ENDIF.
 
      ELSE.
 
        MESSAGE e242(zotc_r1_message) WITH p_tab.
 
      ENDIF.
 
    ENDIF.
 

  ENDMETHOD.
 
  METHOD pop_up_dialogue.
 
    DATA:lv_rc   TYPE i,
 
         lt_file TYPE TABLE OF file_table.
 
    TRY.
 
        gv_wtitle = â€˜Please Select the file'.
 
        cl_gui_frontend_services=>file_open_dialog(       "#EC CI_SUBRC
 
          EXPORTING
 
            window_title            = gv_wtitle                 " Title Of File Open Dialog

          EXCEPTIONS
 
            file_open_dialog_failed = 1                " "Open File" dialog failed
 
            cntl_error              = 2                " Control error
 
            error_no_gui            = 3                " No GUI available
 
            not_supported_by_gui    = 4                " GUI does not support this
 
            OTHERS                  = 5
 
        ).
 

        IF sy-subrc <> 0.
 
          CASE sy-subrc.
 
            WHEN 1.
 
              MESSAGE â€˜file_openDialog_failedâ€™ TYPE 'E'.
 
            WHEN 2.
 
              MESSAGE â€˜Control_Error' TYPE 'E'.
 
            WHEN 3.
 
              MESSAGE â€˜Error_no_guiâ€™ TYPE 'E'.
 
            WHEN 4.
 
              MESSAGE â€˜Not supported by GUIâ€™ TYPE 'E'.
 
            WHEN OTHERS.
 
              MESSAGE â€˜Other issueâ€™ TYPE 'E'.
 
          ENDCASE.
 
        ENDIF.
 
      CATCH cx_root INTO DATA(lx_error).
 
        MESSAGE lx_error->get_text( ) TYPE 'E'.
 
    ENDTRY.
 


    IF lt_file IS NOT INITIAL.
 
      p_path = lt_file[ 1 ]-filename.
 
    ENDIF.
 
  ENDMETHOD.
 
  METHOD initialize.
 
    CLEAR: gs_msg, gt_msg, gv_wtitle       ,
 
     gv_format       ,
 
     gt_dyn_tab      ,
 
     gt_dyn_tab1     ,
 
     go_salv         ,
 
     gv_msg          ,
 
     gt_table_filds  ,
 
     gt_table_filds1 ,
 
     gs_dyn_tab    ,
 
     gv_auth_result.
 
  ENDMETHOD.
 
ENDCLASS.

So ,The output Screen will be as below 
Screenshots / Walkthrough

Export Mode (SE16N)

âœ… Enter a valid custom table name
âœ… Select Export â†’ Runs SE16N for the table




Download the Table Data

Download data as Excel from SE16N and fill in the template

Import Mode

âœ… Select Import, provide the Excel path
âœ… The report validates each entry and updates records

Example:

  • Mismatch in fields shows error in SALV

  • Valid data gets inserted, shown in success message table




If there is mismatch between the table fields and excel fields we will get some validation error or else the data will be inserted & the output will be showed as below.


 

Important Notes

  • This report is built to work only with custom transparent tables (Z-tables)

  • Validation is driven by check tables defined in the Data Dictionary

  • DDIF_FIELDINFO_GET is used to fetch metadata dynamically

Conclusion

This utility provides a robust, flexible, and reusable solution for Excel-based data uploads and downloads involving custom Z-tables. By validating data against check tables and dynamically creating data structures, the tool ensures that only clean, consistent data is written to the database.

Such a tool not only simplifies end-user data entry but also reduces manual effort and errors significantly.

entry.title: How to subscribe or fetch data from solace to CPI using AEM Adapter : part-5
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community!!!

In the solace subscriber layer(fetching data from solace) solace is a powerful Event Broker which its mainly focus on Guaranteed message delivery and while fetching data from solace if the iflow ran into error the solace would retry sending messages even without checking weather its Recoverable or Non-recoverable errors .if its recoverable error the solace retry would meaningful and if it is the non-recoverable errors the doesn't goes to target if solace retry any number of times.

Implementation :
Layer 1 â€“ Solace AEM Sender Adapter subscribes to incoming messages. If an error occurs, it triggers Exception Subprocess for centralized handling, If Error doesn't occur then then the data successfully goes to sftp server. 

Layer 2 â€“ Introduced a Groovy-based classification to detect recoverable vs. non-recoverable errors:
Recoverable: Routed to a successful end (ensuring retry by Solace).


Non-recoverable: Sends a custom property (false) back to Solace to prevent retries and routes to escalation.
Escalation Layer â€“ Built a downstream flow that integrates with Exception handling layer

This Error handling layer can implemented for notifying the type of error occurred with proper details  
Email for developer alerting
ServiceNow for incident creation
Loggly for traceability

So, this is the implementation of solace subscriber  implementation part and i had given the error handling part in the subscriber part as well so by this the end to end our Event Driven Architecture using solace Event Broker series has came to an End.Stay tuned for Upcoming blogs

entry.title: CREATION OF A BOT 'FILE NAME EXTRACTOR TO EXCEL' USING SAP BTP PROCESS AUTOMATION
entry.content:
The main objective of this Bot is to list and logs files into excel for recordkeeping.

So here are the steps to make this bot automation. 

In SAP Build lobby click on create option. 


After clicking create option, create object interface will open. We have to create automation, for this we have to select Automation Process and click Next.


Now we have to choose type, whether this automation is process type or automation type.

As you can see there are two options, that are, Process and automation.

Process: We have to choose Process when we need to build a business process to automate a workflow. Process is used in automation sales order, invoice management, approval flows.

Automation: We have to choose Automation when we need to automate any repetitive tasks across application. Automation is used in extracting data from documents, mass updates of data, local file management.

So, as per our bot we have to select Automation option.

 

           Name: Name Extractor to Excel
           Description: List and logs files into excel for record keeping purpose.
After filling this click on Review. 


Now click on Create


Now click on Create, then click on Automation.



Then we have to configure agent version.




Name: Name Extractor to Excel. Then click on Create.


Now click on setting icon, then click on Dependencies then add option.


Then click on add and then click on Add a Business Process Project Dependency. then add Excel SDK.


Now we will start building our automation by dragging activities from the pannel to the flow.
The activities we have to use for this automation are
                i) Get File Collection
               ii) Open Excel Instances
              iii) Add Workbook
              iv) Set Values (Cells)
               v) Save as Workbook

In get file collection activity, in folder path give the path of the folder which we have to show.
In set values (Cells) activity we have to define the cell ranges for excel sheet
   Values: Coll
In Save as Workbook activity, in file path give the path with the name of the excel sheet where we have to save the list of files in folder.

Save the flow.


Now test the automation.



Conclusion:
This bot will list out the files of a specified folder in an excel worksheet.  

Best Regards,
Smruti Rekha Pradhan

entry.title: Re: Cannot create Transport request in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello @Keratiya_D 

You're seeing this error because you're trying to create a transport request in a system thatâ€™s not assigned the Export Role (likely a customizing or test tenant). You can solve it, only the Development tenant (DEV) with Export Role can create transport requests. Log in to the DEV system and create the transport there.

Please check with your system administrator or BASIS team which system you're logged into and confirm that you're using the correct Export system (DEV) for customizing transport requests.

3-System Landscape and Transport Management

Transport Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud 3SL (2): Parallel Implementation and Maintenance

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: #SITSP2025 ğŸ¤IA Gen AI
entry.content:
Speaker:

ğŸ—£ï¸Josh Blubeard Bentley 

@josh_bentley 

Josh Bentley is a longtime SAP veteran and current Developer & Community Advocate. With a career that began in the 1990s, Josh has worked in IT, solution engineering, and developer advocacyâ€”both at SAP and Red Hat. He is known for his humor, distinctive blue beard, and unwavering commitment to empowering developers and SAP community members worldwide. Today, he helps evangelize SAPâ€™s developer tools, foster in-person connections, and support initiatives like Devtoberfest and Code Jams across the globe.

 

Talk Description:

Joshâ€™s session is more than a presentationâ€”itâ€™s a story-driven journey through two decades of technological change, community growth, and personal transformation. Touching on everything from the early days of SAP mobility to modern GenAI use cases, Josh highlights the evolution of developer advocacy and SAPâ€™s approach to cloud and community engagement. At the heart of his message: the SAP community must stay human, vibrant, and connectedâ€”especially as AI transforms how we interact and learn.

*** Link com todas as palestras ***

Blog Summary:

At SAP Inside Track SÃ£o Paulo 2025, Josh Bentley took the stage not just as a speaker, but as a storyteller. His session wove humor, self-deprecation, and insight into a compelling reflection on the changing landscape of SAP and developer engagement.

He began with the origin of his infamous blue beardâ€”a personal branding decision prompted by a playful dare in 2018. What started as a joke became a symbol: of approachability, personality, and connection in a sometimes impersonal tech world. Itâ€™s an icebreaker that invites interaction in every city he visits.

Josh recounted his journey from managing BlackBerrys at SAPâ€™s Newtown Square campus to his early experiences with mobile platforms like the CIASE unwired platform and SAP Cloud Platform (now SAP BTP). He reflected on his time at Red Hat, where he embraced open source, Kubernetes, and meritocracy before being recruited back to SAP to help explain cloud to sales teams.

The heart of his talk centered around communityâ€”its value, power, and future. He emphasized initiatives like Code Jams, hands-on learning events like the one held the day before at the SAP AppHaus in SÃ£o Paulo. These sessions, he stressed, arenâ€™t sales pitchesâ€”theyâ€™re about real learning, community-building, and access to experts.

Josh also spotlighted DevToberfest, an annual online event that encourages community engagement through live sessions, tutorials, and even prizes. Born during the pandemic, itâ€™s now a core part of SAPâ€™s educational ecosystem, and a lead-up to SAP TechEd. He encouraged attendees to watch developer news, join groups, and become event organizers themselves to keep the ecosystem alive and thriving.

On the topic of AI, he offered both enthusiasm and caution. Tools like SAP's GenAI assistant, Juel, offer powerful productivity boostsâ€”but also risk hallucinations if not properly guided by real human input. He urged the audience to continue contributing real answers to community.sap.com and emphasized that human interaction must remain central to the SAP learning experience.

Josh closed his talk with gratitude and a call to action. Whether through meetups, blogs, or just joining in conversations, every community member has the power to lead, learn, and grow the SAP ecosystem. And in true Bluebeard fashion, he left behind a few community stickers as a thank-you gesture.

 

Key Takeaways:

  • Community and collaboration are critical to SAPâ€™s future in a world of AI.

  • Code Jams and DevToberfest are inclusive, hands-on ways to learn and contribute.

  • Human connections matterâ€”especially when technology moves fast.

  • Anyone can get involved: organize meetups, share answers, and be visible.
